hook.text: Doppler radar can see inside a storm and tell you which way the rain is moving.

buildup.text: It sends out pulses of microwave energy that bounce off raindrops.

discovery.text: The returning signal's frequency shift reveals whether rain is moving toward or away.

twist.text: This same principle lets Doppler radar detect rotation inside thunderstorms.

climax.text: That rotation signature gives tornado warnings up to 15 minutes before touchdown.

punchline.text: Doppler radar sees tornadoes forming before your eyes can. That's 15 minutes of life.

quiz.question: What can Doppler radar detect inside a storm?
options: Rotation that may produce a tornado
